match.title: 2nd ODI
match.hoursInfo: 10.00 start, First Session 10.00-13.30, Interval 13.30-14.15, Second Session 14.15-17.45

headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c RG Sharma b Ashwin 106 (118b 9x4 0x6 125m) SR: 89.83

dismissalComment.html: oh it ends in an anti-climactic fashion! It was a full delivery and he connected well with his sweep, but de Kock is disappointed as he hits it straight to the man at square leg. End of another effortless innings

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c †Dhoni b Mohammed Shami 100 (117b 8x4 0x6 160m) SR: 85.47

dismissalComment.html: oh another wicket from nowhere from India! Just like de Kock was dismissed against the run of play, now Amla get a feather to this slower bouncer en route to the gloves of Dhoni. He was looking to slap it through off, but the extra tennis-ball type bounce probably messed up with the timing of his bat swing..

oh another wicket from nowhere from India! Just like de Kock was dismissed against the run of play, now Amla get a feather to this slower bouncer en route to the gloves of Dhoni. He was looking to slap it through off, but the extra tennis-ball type bounce probably messed up with the timing of his bat swing..

another wicket! This one goes to the bowler! It was a fuller length delivery and heading for the middle stump, Miller plays for the angle, but it just comes in a touch. Hang on, there is a tiny inside edge on that, so Miller is unfortunate on that one, but it looked out to the naked eye

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: It's timbaa!It was full and fast, not quite a yorker, but a full length delivery. It tails in just a touch to creep under Kallis' swing towards the leg side and takes out the leg stump

oh some turn and AB is walking off straightaway! It was a typical left-arm spinner's delivery, coming in from round the wicket, and turning away. AB stretched forward to push it straight down the ground, but didn't account for the spin. Dhoni takes the bails off in a flash and AB has to go.

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers st †Dhoni b Jadeja 3 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: oh some turn and AB is walking off straightaway! It was a typical left-arm spinner's delivery, coming in from round the wicket, and turning away. AB stretched forward to push it straight down the ground, but didn't account for the spin. Dhoni takes the bails off in a flash and AB has to go.

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy run out (Yadav/†Dhoni) 26 (29b 2x4 0x6 45m) SR: 89.65

dismissalComment.html: short of length delivery outside off, Duminy has to wait a touch extra because it comes slow off the pitch. He then slaps it to deep midwicket and calls for a second. But he was stuggling to make it back, he dives, but is not able to beat the throw at the striker's end

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jacques Kallis b Mohammed Shami 10 (13b 1x4 0x6 19m) SR: 76.92

dismissalComment.html: It's timbaa!It was full and fast, not quite a yorker, but a full length delivery. It tails in just a touch to creep under Kallis' swing towards the leg side and takes out the leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c Miller b Morkel 36 (50b 3x4 0x6 64m) SR: 72

dismissalComment.html: oh that is some awesome catch! David Miller takes a stinger at cover! Raina moved his front leg out and blasted that length delivery towards cover. He timed it well and that was off the middle too. But Miller shows super reactions to bend down and take the low catch. Raina watches in disbelief for a few seconds before trudging off

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ravindra Jadeja c de Villiers b Tsotsobe 26 (34b 1x4 1x6 63m) SR: 76.47

dismissalComment.html: AB you beauty! Jadeja gets a length delivery to which he throws his bat, he wanted to hit the sight screen, but this goes high and straight. AB de Villiers, however, lines himself up coming in from long on and leaps in the air to pick this one right on the edge. Wonderful judgment there from the SA captain

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and now Kohli is gone for a duck! Tsotsobe strikes with an angled delivery outside off which was slightly short in length. The batsman tried to steer it down to third man, but it just skims off the face of the bat to the keeper.

caught at short midwicket! This is going the same way as the first one! It was a short of length delivery on the body and Rohit goes for his usual front-foot pull and gets it on the middle too, but he is unable to keep it down. Hashim Amla at short midwicket times his jump to perfection to pluck this one out! Excellent reflex catch there. Loppsy is elated

AB you beauty! Jadeja gets a length delivery to which he throws his bat, he wanted to hit the sight screen, but this goes high and straight. AB de Villiers, however, lines himself up coming in from long on and leaps in the air to pick this one right on the edge. Wonderful judgment there from the SA captain
and more sounds of leather on timber! The series has been wrapped with a slower ball that hits the off stump as the batsman looks to swing it away

and he is gone, caught at point! another length delivery outside off and Dhawan tends to go for these ones, that's what he does, but he is not able to keep it down and it goes straight to the throat of the backward point fielder

and it's over for Ashwin! Steyn gets the wicket with a wide delivery! It was a short ball wide outside off and the batsman wanted to pull it from there, he gets a faint tickle on this one. Similar to the way Rahane got out
not this time! Steyn takes the middle stump out of the ground! This was full, fast and straight. Umesh tried to whip it across the line, but was too slow

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c Duminy b Steyn 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and he is gone, caught at point! another length delivery outside off and Dhawan tends to go for these ones, that's what he does, but he is not able to keep it down and it goes straight to the throat of the backward point fielder

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c †de Kock b Tsotsobe 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and now Kohli is gone for a duck! Tsotsobe strikes with an angled delivery outside off which was slightly short in length. The batsman tried to steer it down to third man, but it just skims off the face of the bat to the keeper.

headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c Amla b Tsotsobe 19 (26b 2x4 0x6 34m) SR: 73.07

dismissalComment.html: caught at short midwicket! This is going the same way as the first one! It was a short of length delivery on the body and Rohit goes for his usual front-foot pull and gets it on the middle too, but he is unable to keep it down. Hashim Amla at short midwicket times his jump to perfection to pluck this one out! Excellent reflex catch there. Loppsy is elated

dismissalText.commentary: Ajinkya Rahane c †de Kock b Morkel 8 (17b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 47.05

dismissalComment.html: short and wide and another wicket! This one was close to the wide marker, but Rahane, unlike two balls ago, chases this one. De Kock takes it and is the first one to appeal, then everyone appeals and the umpire raises the finger

headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni c †de Kock b Philander 19 (31b 0x4 0x6 43m) SR: 61.29

dismissalComment.html: great catch from QDK! It was just outside off, Dhoni didn't move much and pushed at it and managed a thick outside edge. It was probably going past the keeper and de Kock leapt to his right to take the low catch

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c Miller b Morkel 36 (50b 3x4 0x6 64m) SR: 72

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammed Shami b Tsotsobe 8 (14b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: and more sounds of leather on timber! The series has been wrapped with a slower ball that hits the off stump as the batsman looks to swing it away

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammed Shami b Tsotsobe 8 (14b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 57.14

commentTextItems.html: and more sounds of leather on timber! The series has been wrapped with a slower ball that hits the off stump as the batsman looks to swing it away

commentPostTextItems.html: Well that's all from us for tonight, and all the analysis on the day's play will follow soon after. Till then. Ciao ciao.

"The bowlers did well," MS Dhoni says. "They learnt from the last time, but the batsmen played too many shots. I think the shot selection was not right. The SA attack are very accurate and they keep bowling in the same areas and that's what makes them different. Overall, there was not much for the bowlers, not much seam or swing, so that's why I say they bowled well. The pitch was a nice one and the target was a decent one, and we didn't execute our plans with the bat. I don't get too much worried about the losses, how we stand up from here is what i want to see. That will test our character."

"It was a very emotional day and I am glad we came out here and played good cricket," AB de Villiers says. "We have been searching for consistency for a long time and to do it against the No 1 team is a job well done. Quinton and Hash have been very good up front, we struggled towards the end. I though 230-240 was par score, so to get 280 was very good. Quinton de Kock is a very aggressive player, the day I met him, I thought this guys will go far."

Quinton de Kock is the Man of the Match. He says, "It's very satisfying. During tough times, people hate you, so in times like these, you have to enjoy yourselves. I was not so happy to take Dhoni's catch because at that stage, we were looking to get to the 20 over mark and I thought we didn't need a wicket then. "

What an annihilation this has been! 141-run loss followed by 134-run humiliation. The South African bowlers maintained their menacing intensity on a pitch that had half the venom of Jo'Burg. Defending a decent 280, they again terrorised the Indian top order to leave them in tatters within the first 10 overs. From then on, it was just a matter of time and they complete a series win with a game to play. Excellent batting by Hashim Amla and Quinton de Kock, who gave South Africa another strong start, and both got their respective hundreds. They might not have been happy with the final total, but their bowlers made it look like a mountain. Dale Steyn nipped out Dhawan early, then softened up Kohli and all the fast bowlers feasted...
yogi d: "35.1 overs where SA lost their first wicket, at the same point India lost their 10th, that tells the story"

Sandeep: "Someone was attributing India's poor performance to the lack of match practices in SA and the grueling schedule etc. PAK went to SA after playing back to back matches in UAE and even with not much time to adjust to the new conditions, they performed much better! There is no excuse for getting exposed for our weaknesses!"

Rohail: "This series win is equally important for the South African cricket board. After all the arrogance, the bullying, months of schedule changing and dictation by the BCCI, their team still gets hammered and brought back to reality. Hope SA hammer all the nails in the coffin and win in all formats."

commentTextItems.html: he gets an outside edge this time and it goes to the third slip fielder on the bounce

commentPostTextItems.html: Two of India's three heaviest defeats against SA while chasing have come at Durban - 157 runs, 2006 and 135 runs, 2011

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: and another one beats the bat outside off as Ishant fishes for it

dismissalText.commentary: Umesh Yadav b Steyn 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 20

commentTextItems.html: not this time! Steyn takes the middle stump out of the ground! This was full, fast and straight. Umesh tried to whip it across the line, but was too slow

commentPreTextItems.html: Oatile: "Lets assume SA declared after losing the first wicket, then does India stand a chance of winning?"

commentTextItems.html: and this one beats the bat and somehow beats the middle stump too! Just bounces over
another poke and a miss from the batsman as this one flies quickly to the keeper
he bowls a short delivery outside off and the batsman lets this one go
now a quick short ball, Shami attempts a pull anyway but again, makes no connection

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: a slower ball this time, but again the batsman is beaten outside off
he moves outside leg stump and swings his bat at that, but misses it completely. Loppsy smiles

commentPreTextItems.html: Umesh Yadav has come in just before the start of the Powerplay..

commentTextItems.html: back of length delivery from Loppsy is tucked to the left of backward point for a single

dismissalText.commentary: Ravindra Jadeja c de Villiers b Tsotsobe 26 (34b 1x4 1x6 63m) SR: 76.47

commentTextItems.html: AB you beauty! Jadeja gets a length delivery to which he throws his bat, he wanted to hit the sight screen, but this goes high and straight. AB de Villiers, however, lines himself up coming in from long on and leaps in the air to pick this one right on the edge. Wonderful judgment there from the SA captain
he gets a full delivery that he slices down to third man for a single
on the pads and Jadeja turns it straight to backward square leg

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: he comes forward and dabs it for a single to cover, but a ricochet allows the batsman to pick up an extra
stays in the crease and punches it to long on for a single
he almost drives it back to the bowler, but it drops just short
slightly shorter and Jadeja has to wait a bit before cutting it hard to deep point
the flatter delivery is whipped to deep square leg for a single
he is going to throw is bat at everything it seems as he slaps the back of length delivery to deep midwicket again

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c Duminy b Steyn 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and he is gone, caught at point! another length delivery outside off and Dhawan tends to go for these ones, that's what he does, but he is not able to keep it down and it goes straight to the throat of the backward point fielder

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c †de Kock b Tsotsobe 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and now Kohli is gone for a duck! Tsotsobe strikes with an angled delivery outside off which was slightly short in length. The batsman tried to steer it down to third man, but it just skims off the face of the bat to the keeper.

dismissalText.commentary: Ajinkya Rahane c †de Kock b Morkel 8 (17b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 47.05

dismissalComment.html: short and wide and another wicket! This one was close to the wide marker, but Rahane, unlike two balls ago, chases this one. De Kock takes it and is the first one to appeal, then everyone appeals and the umpire raises the finger

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c Miller b Morkel 36 (50b 3x4 0x6 64m) SR: 72

dismissalComment.html: oh that is some awesome catch! David Miller takes a stinger at cover! Raina moved his front leg out and blasted that length delivery towards cover. He timed it well and that was off the middle too. But Miller shows super reactions to bend down and take the low catch. Raina watches in disbelief for a few seconds before trudging off

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni c †de Kock b Philander 19 (31b 0x4 0x6 43m) SR: 61.29

dismissalComment.html: great catch from QDK! It was just outside off, Dhoni didn't move much and pushed at it and managed a thick outside edge. It was probably going past the keeper and de Kock leapt to his right to take the low catch

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ravindra Jadeja c de Villiers b Tsotsobe 26 (34b 1x4 1x6 63m) SR: 76.47

dismissalComment.html: AB you beauty! Jadeja gets a length delivery to which he throws his bat, he wanted to hit the sight screen, but this goes high and straight. AB de Villiers, however, lines himself up coming in from long on and leaps in the air to pick this one right on the edge. Wonderful judgment there from the SA captain

dismissalText.commentary: Ravichandran Ashwin c †de Kock b Steyn 15 (26b 1x4 0x6 35m) SR: 57.69

dismissalComment.html: and it's over for Ashwin! Steyn gets the wicket with a wide delivery! It was a short ball wide outside off and the batsman wanted to pull it from there, he gets a faint tickle on this one. Similar to the way Rahane got out

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammed Shami b Tsotsobe 8 (14b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: and more sounds of leather on timber! The series has been wrapped with a slower ball that hits the off stump as the batsman looks to swing it away

dismissalText.commentary: Umesh Yadav b Steyn 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: not this time! Steyn takes the middle stump out of the ground! This was full, fast and straight. Umesh tried to whip it across the line, but was too slow

dismissalText.commentary: Ishant Sharma not out 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and he is gone, caught at point! another length delivery outside off and Dhawan tends to go for these ones, that's what he does, but he is not able to keep it down and it goes straight to the throat of the backward point fielder

and it's over for Ashwin! Steyn gets the wicket with a wide delivery! It was a short ball wide outside off and the batsman wanted to pull it from there, he gets a faint tickle on this one. Similar to the way Rahane got out
not this time! Steyn takes the middle stump out of the ground! This was full, fast and straight. Umesh tried to whip it across the line, but was too slow

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and now Kohli is gone for a duck! Tsotsobe strikes with an angled delivery outside off which was slightly short in length. The batsman tried to steer it down to third man, but it just skims off the face of the bat to the keeper.

caught at short midwicket! This is going the same way as the first one! It was a short of length delivery on the body and Rohit goes for his usual front-foot pull and gets it on the middle too, but he is unable to keep it down. Hashim Amla at short midwicket times his jump to perfection to pluck this one out! Excellent reflex catch there. Loppsy is elated

But Miller shows super reactions to bend down and take the low catch. Raina watches in disbelief for a few seconds before trudging off

dismissalComment.html: great catch from QDK! It was just outside off, Dhoni didn't move much and pushed at it and managed a thick outside edge. It was probably going past the keeper and de Kock leapt to his right to take the low catch

stories.title: India v South Africa, 2013-14
stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: India v South Africa, 2013-14; Wisden Almanack review
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the second ODI, India v South Africa, 2013-14

stories.title: 'We're nowhere near the No. 1 team in the world' - de Villiers
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 2nd ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: 'We're nowhere near the No. 1 team in the world' - de Villiers
stories.summary: AB de Villiers, the South Africa captain, said he expected India to bounce back in the third ODI, after his side beat the visitors by 134 runs to win the second ODI and the series in Durban

image.caption: Virat Kohli trudges back to the pavilion after getting a duck
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli trudges back to the pavilion after getting a duck, South Africa v India, 2nd ODI, Durban, December 8, 2013

stories.title: Top-order failures creating pressure - Dhoni
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 2nd ODI, Durban
stories.summary: MS Dhoni was satisfied by how his bowlers made a comeback from the pasting in Johannesburg and in the first half of this match, but his batsmen left him disappointed this time

image.caption: Virat Kohli trudges back to the pavilion after getting a duck
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli trudges back to the pavilion after getting a duck, South Africa v India, 2nd ODI, Durban, December 8, 2013

stories.title: Amla 'a bit embarrassed' by beating Richards to 4000
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 2nd ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: Hashim Amla 'a bit embarrassed' by beating Viv Richards to 4000
stories.summary: Following South Africa's thrashing of India in Durban, Hashim Amla said he it was "embarrassing" to beat Viv Richards' record for the fastest to 4000 runs in ODIs

image.caption: Quinton de Kock notched his second consecutive ODI century
image.longCaption: Quinton de Kock notched his second consecutive ODI century, South Africa v India, 2nd ODI, Durban, December 8, 2013

stories.title: South Africa cruise to series win
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 2nd ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: South Africa cruise to series win
stories.summary: India made significant changes to their bowling attack, played on a surface far more suited to them and showed some improvement from Thursday, but the end result was still the same

image.caption: Quinton de Kock steers the ball to the leg side
image.longCaption: Quinton de Kock steers the ball to the leg side, South Africa v Pakistan, 2nd ODI, Port Elizabeth, November 27, 2013

stories.title: 'No one in Indian team is frightened of anything' - Kohli
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 2nd ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: 'No one in Indian team is frightened of anything' - Virat Kohli
stories.summary: Virat Kohli was left to defend his fellow India batsmen against statements from the opposition that some of them might have been frightened in the first ODI against South Africa

image.caption: Rohit Sharma struggled to get bat on ball a few times
image.longCaption: Rohit Sharma struggled to get bat on ball a few times, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Johannesburg, December 5, 2013

stories.title: South Africa might have scared India batsmen, says Steyn
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 2nd ODI, Durban
stories.seoTitle: South Africa might have scared India batsmen, says Dale Steyn
stories.summary: Dale Steyn has said some of the Indian batsmen were frightened in the first ODI, and that their bowling needs an injection of pace if they are to bother South Africa

image.caption: Ravindra Jadeja was bowled by Jacques Kallis for 29
image.longCaption: Ravindra Jadeja was bowled by Jacques Kallis for 29, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Johannesburg, December 5, 2013
